return.description:
For SELECT, SHOW, DESCRIBE, EXPLAIN and other statements returning resultset,
   mysql_query 
   returns a resource on success, or FALSE on
   error.For other type of SQL statements, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE, DROP, etc,
   mysql_query returns TRUE on success
   or FALSE on error.The returned result resource should be passed to
   mysql_fetch_array, and other
   functions for dealing with result tables, to access the returned data.Use mysql_num_rows to find out how many rows
   were returned for a SELECT statement or
   mysql_affected_rows to find out how many
   rows were affected by a DELETE, INSERT, REPLACE, or UPDATE
   statement.mysql_query will also fail and return FALSE
   if the user does not have permission to access the table(s) referenced by
   the query.
